insert: insert into t_student (STU_ID, STU_NO, STU_SEX, STU_NAME, NATIVE_PLACE, STU_DEPART_NO, STU_CLASS_NO) values (#{stuId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{stuNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{stuSex,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{stuName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{nativePlace,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{stuDepartNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{stuClassNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
update: update t_student set STU_NO = #{stuNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, STU_SEX = #{stuSex,jdbcType=CHAR}, STU_NAME = #{stuName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, NATIVE_PLACE = #{nativePlace,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, STU_DEPART_NO = #{stuDepartNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, STU_CLASS_NO = #{stuClassNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where STU_ID = #{stuId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
select: select T.STU_ID as T_STU_ID, T.STU_NO as T_STU_NO, T.STU_SEX as T_STU_SEX, T.STU_NAME as T_STU_NAME, T.NATIVE_PLACE as T_NATIVE_PLACE, T.STU_DEPART_NO as T_STU_DEPART_NO, T.STU_CLASS_NO as T_STU_CLASS_NO from t_student T where STU_ID = #{stuId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

select T.STU_ID as T_STU_ID, T.STU_NO as T_STU_NO, T.STU_SEX as T_STU_SEX, T.STU_NAME as T_STU_NAME, T.NATIVE_PLACE as T_NATIVE_PLACE, T.STU_DEPART_NO as T_STU_DEPART_NO, T.STU_CLASS_NO as T_STU_CLASS_NO from t_student T
